gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: R2 Water Quality Portal Monitoring Stations

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. EPA Office of Environmental Information (OEI)

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Water Quality Data Portal (WQP) provides an easy way to access data stored in various large water quality databases. The WQP provides various input parameters on the form including location, site, sampling, and date parameters to filter and customize the returned results. The The Water Quality Portal (WQP) is a cooperative service sponsored by the United States Geological Survey (USGS), the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and the National Water Quality Monitoring Council (NWQMC) that integrates publicly available water quality data from the USGS National Water Information System (NWIS) the EPA STOrage and RETrieval (STORET) Data Warehouse, and the USDA ARS Sustaining The EarthÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Watersheds - Agricultural Research Database System (STEWARDS).

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The Water Quality Portal WQP can return site information (locations where samples were collected), or it can return sample results (analytical data of collected samples). This ArcGIS SDE point feature class (Geographic NAD83) was generated from a WQP down load of statons in the Region 2 geographic extent.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 2, GIS Team
